column4: ubuntu 12.10 -  Unity is really slow on my low powered netbook. Is there something I can do to make it quicker? I know there used to be a 2D mode but that seems to have been removed in 12.10?
Will you use something that isn't Unity?
this netbook will be used by several people whom don't have time to learn yet another UI. Unity is set up in such a way it meets their needs
ATOM doesn't have a very good GPU
is there a reason you moved away from 12.04
12.04 had the same unity slowness issues
but it still runs Unity 2D, you can't ask a 3D desktop to run really well on underpowered hardware
I don't get why the 3D desktop is the default install option then. It hardly seems like a sound decision
thus the advantage of Linux, you have a world of options! try setting up XFCE with Docky or something
it's not great for a beginner to have to modify things like that
I assume you are the admin on the box, why don't you set it up for them?
yes I am, I think you're missing the point though
not only do I now need to invest time into changing the desktop, I also have to invest time training the users or writing docs
just see it as a lesson to look for the lowest common denominator in hardware and how you're decisions effect it.
your attitude is not aligned with that of people with real work to do. As a hobbyist, I have no issues doing this. From a business stand point, I do
it seems like you got dogged by your IT guys, check your direct messages
